discussion.content: The Risk does not take the advantage. It is the threat that takes the advantage. The Risk suffered the advantage from the Threat which exploit a Vulnerability.

Risk is the potential that a given threat will exploit vulnerabilities 
https://vwannabe.com/2017/01/20/ccna-cyber-ops-2-0-security-concepts/

comments.content:
Dude, the article literally states what the question states:

"2.2.b Threat: In computer security, a threat is a possible danger that might exploit a vulnerability to breach security and therefore cause possible harm."

discussion.content: Answer should be B. A Risk

questions.question_text: Which term represents a potential danger that could take advantage of a weakness in a system?
In which one of the following layers of the OSI model does the router primarily operate?

discussion.content: Lvl 7: Next-Gen routers route on applications

questions.question_text: Which three types of devices can do network address translation (NAT)? (Choose three.)

comments.content:
Agree, B is wrong.

L3 switches do not support NAT as a general rule (except the exception of the 6500 and 6800).

discussion.content: answer is ADF per Cisco CCNA CyberOps SECFND 210-250 page 118

questions.question_text: Which TCP flag(s) must be set in a packet in order for the packet to match an ACL entry that contains the established keyword?

choices.A: DHCP relay is required if the DHCP clients and the DHCP servers are located in the same broadcast domain
choices.E: When the DHCP relay agent receives a broadcast packet from a connected client, it changes the giaddr field from zero to the relay agent IP address, and forwards the message to the DHCP server.
choices.D: DHCP discovery messages are broadcasted from the DHCP relay agent to the DHCP servers.
choices.C: The primary function of a DHCP relay agent is to relay the DHCP messages from the local DHCP clients to the remote DHCP servers.
choices.B: The DHCP server uses the ciaddr IP address to select an IP address pool from which to assign the IP addresses to the DHCP client.

discussion.content: For more on answer E, please read https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios/12_4t/ip_addr/configuration/guide/htdhcpre.html
